abusefilter-edit-builder-vars-user-mobil: AbuseFilter extension rule variable that allows distinguishing edits based on if they have been made using the editor of MobileFrontend or not.
mobile-frontend-changeslist-nocomment: Text to mark an empty edit summary in mobile watchlist/history/recentchanges overview.
mobile-frontend-cite-error: Error message shown to user when citations fail to load which should only happen if a bad revision identifier is given.
mobile-frontend-cite-none-available: Error message shown when no citations are available for a page.
mobile-frontend-clear-search:
Tooltip for clear button that appears when you type into search box.
{{Identical|Clear}}
mobile-frontend-diffview-404-desc: Text for 404 page when bad revision id parameter is passed
mobile-frontend-diffview-404-title: Heading on 404 page when bad revision ID parameter is passed.
mobile-frontend-diffview-anonymous:
Label to indicate anonymous user in common mobile diff/change view.
{{Identical|Anonymous user}}
mobile-frontend-diffview-bytesadded:
Edit byte-changed counter for common mobile diff/change view when change adds bytes.

Parameters:
* $1 - byte count; may use PLURAL
mobile-frontend-diffview-bytesnochange: Edit byte-changed counter for common mobile diff/change view when the edit didn't change the size of the page.
mobile-frontend-diffview-bytesremoved:
Edit byte-changed counter for common mobile diff/change view when change removes bytes.

Parameters:
* $1 - byte count; may use PLURAL
mobile-frontend-diffview-editcount:
Edit count of user in common mobile diff/change view. Parameters:
* $1 - the count, may use PLURAL
Ensure number is wrapped in a div element.
{{Identical|Edit}}
mobile-frontend-edit-login-action: Message shown above the login form when it is reached from a link in the editor.
mobile-frontend-edit-signup-action: Message shown above the signup form when it is reached from a link in the editor.
mobile-frontend-editor-anon: Title for link to edit a page without logging in.
mobile-frontend-editor-anonwarning: A warning message, when user tries to edit without logging in.
mobile-frontend-editor-blocked-drawer-ac:
Label for a button in the mobile block message drawer.
{{identical|Log in}}
Label for a button in the mobile block message drawer.
Label for a button in the mobile block message drawer. The button links to [[Special:RandomPage]].
mobile-frontend-editor-blocked-drawer-bo: Text for a link on the mobile block message drawer
mobile-frontend-editor-blocked-drawer-re: Header for the block reason message that appears when a blocked user attempts to edit.
mobile-frontend-editor-blocked-drawer-cr:
Header for the block creator that appears when a blocked user attempts to edit. 
Parameters:
* $1 - user's gender
mobile-frontend-editor-blocked-drawer-ex: Header for the block expiry that appears when a blocked user attempts to edit.
mobile-frontend-editor-blocked-drawer-he:
Label for the help link in the drawer that appears when a blocked user attempts to edit.
{{Identical|Detail}}
mobile-frontend-editor-generic-block-rea: Generic error message when we cannot parse the reason why page is blocked from editing. Should not include full stop as used by {{msg-mw|mobile-frontend-editor-blocked-info}}.
mobile-frontend-editor-cancel:
Caption for cancel button on edit form.
{{Identical|Cancel}}
mobile-frontend-editor-cancel-confirm: Question asking user if they are positive about abandoning unsaved edit.
mobile-frontend-editor-captcha-try-again: A message shown when user enters wrong CAPTCHA and a new one is displayed.
mobile-frontend-editor-continue:
Caption for the next (as in "next step") button on edit form which takes you to the screen that shows a preview and license information.
{{Identical|Next}}
mobile-frontend-editor-disabled: Toast message that appears when a user is unable to edit a page and clicks edit icon. $1 is a URL.
mobile-frontend-editor-disabled-anon: Message that appears in a drawer when a user is not logged in and anonymous edits are disabled.
mobile-frontend-editor-editing:
A heading indicating that the user is currently editing.
{{Identical|Editing}}
mobile-frontend-editor-error:
Text that displays when there have been errors when saving a page edit.

Used as "toast" error message.
mobile-frontend-editor-error-conflict:
Text that displays when there has been edit conflict when saving a page edit.

Used as "toast" error message.
mobile-frontend-editor-error-loading:
Text that displays when there have been errors when loading a page section in the editor.

Used as "toast" error message.
mobile-frontend-editor-error-preview: Error message for when a preview fails to load for an unknown reason
mobile-frontend-editor-keep-editing: Caption for a button that takes you back to editing from edit preview screen.
mobile-frontend-license-links:
{{notranslate}}
Overriden by {{msg-mw|wikimedia-mobile-license-links}} or set on wiki.
mobile-frontend-editor-licensing:
Text notifying user of license that text will be published under.
Parameters:
* $1 - link to license
* $2 - If $1 contains more than one license (1 -> one license; 2 -> more licenses)
mobile-frontend-editor-licensing-with-te:
Text notifying user of license that text will be published under.
Parameters:
* $1 - link to terms of service, see {{msg-mw|Mobile-frontend-editor-terms-link}}
* $2 - link to license
* $3 - If $1 contains more than one license (1 -> one license; 2 -> more licenses)
mobile-frontend-editor-terms-link:
Terms of Use link used in {{msg-mw|Mobile-frontend-editor-licensing-with-terms}}.
Parameters:
* $1 - URL, link target
mobile-frontend-editor-new-page-confirm:
Question asking user if they are positive they want to create a new page.
Parameters:
* $1 - the username for GENDER
mobile-frontend-editor-placeholder-new-p:
Placeholder text for new pages.

Parameters:
* $1 - the username for GENDER
mobile-frontend-editor-previewing-page:
A heading saying what page is being previewed after editing. All text should be wrapped in a STRONG tag except the page title itself. Note that STRONG text pushes the buttons off-screen when it's too long (vertical mobile display), but the SPAN part is shortened in that case with an ellipsis (...) before the buttons.

Parameters:
* $1 - page title
{{Related|Mobile-frontend-editor-page}}
mobile-frontend-editor-publish:
Caption for publish button on edit form.
{{Identical|Publish}}
mobile-frontend-editor-save:
Caption for save button on edit form.
{{Identical|Save}}
mobile-frontend-editor-success:
Text that displays when a page edit has been successfully published.

Used as "toast" message.

See also:
* {{msg-mw|Mobile-frontend-editor-success-landmark-1}}
mobile-frontend-editor-success-new-page:
Text that displays when a new page has been successfully published.

Used as "toast" message.
mobile-frontend-editor-summary-placehold: A placeholder with examples for the summary input field asking user what they changed (the field is optional).
mobile-frontend-editor-summary-request: Header above edit summary input field asking the user to summarize the changes they made to the page.
mobile-frontend-editor-switch-editor: Label for button that allows the user to switch between two different editing interfaces
mobile-frontend-editor-switch-visual-edi: Label for button that switches to the "visual editor" (a WYSIWYG editing interface). Appears near {{msg-mw|mobile-frontend-editor-source-editor}}. See [[:mw:VisualEditor]].
mobile-frontend-editor-uploadenable: Shown when try to edit a new file page.
mobile-frontend-editor-viewing-source-pa:
A heading saying which page's source code is being viewed. All text should be wrapped in a STRONG tag except the page title itself. Note that STRONG text pushes the buttons off-screen when it's too long (vertical mobile display), but the SPAN part is shortened in that case with an ellipsis (...) before the buttons.

Parameters:
* $1 - page title
{{Related|Mobile-frontend-editor-page}}
mobile-frontend-editor-wait: Text that displays while a page edit is being saved.
mobile-frontend-editor-loading: Text that displays while the mobile visual editor is loading.
mobile-frontend-fontchanger-desc: Link to open the font size change menu out of [[Special:MobileOptions]].
mobile-frontend-featured-article: Label shown before a link or other form of display of an area of the page (usually main page of the wiki) which contains its "featured content", i.e. something contained in the wiki which is considered particularly good and is promoted for a period of time in prominent places of the wiki.
mobile-frontend-generic-404-desc: Generic description of the HTTP 404 error shown to users
mobile-frontend-generic-404-title:
Title for a generic HTTP 404 error page.
{{Identical|Page not found}}
mobile-frontend-history-404-desc: Explain the reasons why the user may have arrived on {{msg-mw|mobile-frontend-history-404-title}}
mobile-frontend-history-404-title: Title of the 404 error page shown when navigate to [[Special:History/Title of page that does not exist]]
mobile-frontend-history-no-results: Error shown when there are no history entires for a given/invalid filter.
mobile-frontend-joined-just-now: Shown on user pages providing information how long the user is registered (in this case, less than 10 seconds = just now). Parameter $1 gender.
mobile-frontend-joined-seconds: Shown on user pages providing information how long the user is registered. Parameters: $1: gender, $2: number of seconds
mobile-frontend-joined-minutes:
Shown on user pages providing information how long the user is registered. Parameters:
* $1: gender
* $2: number of minutes
mobile-frontend-joined-hours:
Shown on user pages providing information how long the user is registered. Parameters:
* $1: gender
* $2: number of hours
mobile-frontend-joined-days:
Shown on user pages providing information how long the user is registered. Parameters:
* $1: gender
* $2: number of days
mobile-frontend-joined-months:
Shown on user pages providing information how long the user is registered. Parameters:
* $1: gender
* $2: number of months
mobile-frontend-joined-years:
Shown on user pages providing information how long the user is registered. Parameters:
* $1: gender
* $2: number of years
mobile-frontend-language-heading:
The title for the list of languages for a page.
{{Identical|Language}}
mobile-frontend-languages-404-desc: The title for this message is {{msg-mw|Mobile-frontend-languages-404-title}}.
mobile-frontend-languages-404-title: Used as title for the description {{msg-mw|Mobile-frontend-languages-404-desc}}.
mobile-frontend-languages-header-page:
Header used for list of alternate languages that a page is available in.

Parameters:
* $1 - The name of the page
{{Identical|Language}}
mobile-frontend-languages-nonexistent-ti:
Shown as error message on [[Special:MobileLanguages]] when the title parameter given does not map to an existing page.

Parameters:
* $1 - page title
mobile-frontend-languages-text:
Parameters:
* $1 - page title
* $2 - number of languages
See also:
* {{msg-mw|Mobile-frontend-languages-header|page title}}
mobile-frontend-languages-structured-ove:
Title of the suggested languages in the structured language overlay. The text will be upper-cased with JS and CSS.
See also {{msg-wm|uls-uls-common-languages}}
Title of all languages in the structured language overlay. The text will be upper-cased with JS and CSS.
Instructional text for the language overlay search input box
Shown when language search failed to find any matching languages
Explanation message shown when language search failed to find any matching languages
mobile-frontend-last-modified-date:
Text that displays the date the page was last modified. Parameters:
* $1 - date
* $2 - time
{{Related|Mobile-frontend-last-modified}}
mobile-frontend-last-modified-with-user-:
Text displayed on page to show how long ago the page was updated and who updated it. Parameters:
* $1 - user's gender
* $2 - username
* $3 - number of days
* $4 - URL to page history
* $5 - integer. When 0, the user is anonymous. When 1, the user is named
* $6 - link to user's profile
{{Related|Mobile-frontend-last-modified-with-user}}

Text displayed on page to show how long ago the page was updated and who updated it. Parameters:
* $1 - user's gender
* $2 - username
* $3 - number of hours
* $4 - URL to page history
* $5 - integer. When 0, the user is anonymous. When 1, the user is named
* $6 - link to user's profile
{{Related|Mobile-frontend-last-modified-with-user}}

Text displayed on page to show when a page was very recently updated and who updated it. Parameters:
* $1 - user's gender
* $2 - username
* $3 - URL to page history
* $4 - integer. When 0, the user is anonymous. When 1, the user is named
* $5 - URL to user's profile
{{Related|Mobile-frontend-last-modified-with-user}}

Text displayed on page to show how long ago the page was updated and who updated it. Parameters:
* $1 - user's gender
* $2 - username
* $3 - number of minutes
* $4 - URL to page history
* $5 - integer. When 0, the user is anonymous. When 1, the user is named
* $6 - URL to user's profile
{{Related|Mobile-frontend-last-modified-with-user}}

Text displayed on page to show how long ago the page was updated and who updated it. Parameters:
* $1 - user's gender
* $2 - username
* $3 - number of months
* $4 - URL to page history
* $5 - integer. When 0, the user is anonymous. When 1, the user is named
* $6 - URL to user's profile
{{Related|Mobile-frontend-last-modified-with-user}}

Text displayed on page to show how long ago the page was updated and who updated it. Parameters:
* $1 - user's gender
* $2 - username
* $3 - number of seconds
* $4 - URL to page history
* $5 - integer. When 0, the user is anonymous. When 1, the user is named
* $6 - URL to user's profile
{{Related|Mobile-frontend-last-modified-with-user}}

Text displayed on page to show how long ago the page was updated and who updated it. Parameters:
* $1 - user's gender
* $2 - username
* $3 - number of years
* $4 - URL to page history
* $5 - integer. When 0, the user is anonymous. When 1, the user is named
* $6 - URL to user's profile
{{Related|Mobile-frontend-last-modified-with-user}}
mobile-frontend-main-menu: Message that is displayed as a tooltip for the main menu icon in the header
mobile-frontend-media-details:
Caption for a button leading to the details of a media file (e.g. an image) in a preview.
{{Identical|Detail}}
mobile-frontend-media-license-link:
Link to license information in media viewer.
{{Identical|License information}}
mobile-frontend-media-load-fail-message: Message shown when media loading fails
mobile-frontend-media-load-fail-retry:
Link to reload page that's shown when media loading fails
{{Identical|Refresh}}
mobile-frontend-missing-image:
When the mobile site removes images it replaces them with a link to the image and the alt text of the image. If no alt text is provided this string is shown to inform the user it is an image.
{{Identical|Image}}
mobile-frontend-tap-to-display-image: Alert the user that they need to click the image to display it
mobile-frontend-nearby-distance:
States distance to current location. Parameters:
* $1 - distance (in kilometers)
See also:
* {{msg-mw|Mobile-frontend-nearby-distance-meters}}
mobile-frontend-nearby-distance-meters:
States distance to current location for numbers less than 1km.

Parameters:
* $1 - distance (in meters)
See also:
* {{msg-mw|Mobile-frontend-nearby-distance}}
mobile-frontend-nearby-error: Text of generic error message when querying geodata API.
mobile-frontend-nearby-error-guidance: Message explaining actions user can take when keying error {{msg-mw|mobile-frontend-nearby-error}}
mobile-frontend-nearby-noresults: Message shown when nothing is nearby
mobile-frontend-nearby-noresults-guidanc: Message explaining actions user can take when keying error {{msg-mw|mobile-frontend-nearby-noresults}}
mobile-frontend-nearby-permission-denied: Error message shown as alert when location was not found due to browser settings/permissions.
mobile-frontend-nearby-location-unavaila: Error message shown as alert when location was not provided by the browser (example: not in range)
mobile-frontend-nearby-requirements: Message shown to users who have no JavaScript or a browser that is not capable
mobile-frontend-nearby-requirements-guid: Message explaining actions user can take when keying error {{msg-mw|mobile-frontend-nearby-requirements}}
mobile-frontend-nearby-info-heading: Heading title for Nearby info page
mobile-frontend-news-items: The title that will appear before the element with the mf-itn selector.
mobile-frontend-opt-in-explain: Used as description for the "Beta" in [[Special:MobileOptions]], if the beta is not enabled.
mobile-frontend-overlay-close:
Text for the button in an overlay that, when clicked, dismisses the overlay.
{{Identical|Close}}
mobile-frontend-privacy-link-text:
Custom version of "Privacy policy" link text for mobile footer, intended to be as brief as possible to take up as little screen real estate as possible.
{{Identical|Privacy}}
mobile-frontend-references-citation:
The title of the reference drawer that opens up when a reference link is clicked.
{{Identical|Citation}}
mobile-frontend-references-citation-erro: Error message body that shows when a citation fails to load via the API.
mobile-frontend-references-list: Label for a link to the list of the citations in the article.
mobile-frontend-requires-mobile:
Message that shows when a special page does not have a desktop equivalent.

Points user to mobile view link at bottom of page to switch to mobile.

This should be consistent with {{msg-mw|Mobile-frontend-view}}.
mobile-frontend-requires-title: Title shown on page when the page is not available to the user. Currently used for special pages that have no mobile/desktop equivalent or that are only available as experimental features.
mobile-frontend-return-to-page: The text of the link that takes the user back to the article
mobile-frontend-save-error: Error message shown when a user tries to save settings form without cookies present.
mobile-frontend-save-settings:
Text for button for saving settings on [[Special:MobileOptions]]. Since this appears on the settings page translating the word save is sufficient
{{Identical|Save}}
mobile-frontend-search-content:
Caption for a button performing full text search of a given search query.

Used in {{msg-mw|Mobile-frontend-search-content-no-results}}.
mobile-frontend-search-content-no-result:
Used when no pages with matching titles were found.

Refers to {{msg-mw|Mobile-frontend-search-content}}.
mobile-frontend-search-no-results: Message informing user that no pages were found for a given query.
mobile-frontend-settings-tagline: Tagline for Special:MobileOptions - will show under heading
mobile-frontend-settings-beta: Text for beta on settings page.
mobile-frontend-settings-save: Notification which shows to user when settings are saved.
mobile-frontend-talk-add-overlay-content: Placeholder text to prompt user to add content to talk page content
mobile-frontend-talk-add-overlay-subject:
Placeholder text to prompt user to add a new talk page topic subject. This corresponds to {{msg-mw|subject}} in desktop MediaWiki.
{{Identical|Subject}}
mobile-frontend-talk-add-overlay-submit: Label for button which submits a new talk page topic
mobile-frontend-talk-reply-info: Inform the user their talk reply will be automatically signed.
mobile-frontend-talk-topic-error: Generic error message, if the topic can't be saved, due to an unknown reason.
mobile-frontend-talk-topic-error-protect: Error message, when the user tries to add a discussion to a protected talk page.
mobile-frontend-talk-topic-error-permiss: Error message, when the topic wasn't added to the talk page, because of a permission problem (no edit permission e.g.).
mobile-frontend-talk-topic-error-spam: Error message explain, that the topic was rejected, because it's identified as spam.
mobile-frontend-talk-topic-error-badtoke: This error message explains, that there was an error with the server (bad edit token), so the topic can't be saved to the talk page. The user should try to reload the page in his browser.
mobile-frontend-talk-topic-wait: Text that displays while a new topic on a talk page is being saved.
mobile-frontend-terms-text:
"Terms of use" link text at the bottom of every page.
{{Identical|Terms of use}}
mobile-frontend-view:
This is a link that appears at the bottom of a desktop view wiki page near {{msg-mw|privacy}} and {{msg-mw|disclaimers}}. Clicking it takes the user to a mobile view of the page.

Corresponds to {{msg-mw|Mobile-frontend-view-desktop}}, which is shown in the mobile view, and should be similar to it.
mobile-frontend-watchlist-a-z:
Label for a button that takes you to an A-Z list of all items in your watchlist.
{{Identical|List}}
mobile-frontend-watchlist-a-z-empty-howt: Alt text for image explaining how to watch pages
mobile-frontend-watchlist-add:
Notification message when you add a page to your watchlist
*$1 - the title of the article
mobile-frontend-watchlist-back-home: Label for button that takes you back to main page from empty watchlist
mobile-frontend-watchlist-cta: Appears when you click watchlist icon when not logged in. First link is to login form, 2nd to sign up form. Links are created in JavaScript.
mobile-frontend-watchlist-cta-button-log:
A link with label to login page
{{Identical|Log in}}
mobile-frontend-watchlist-cta-button-sig:
A link with label to sign up page
{{Identical|Sign up}}
mobile-frontend-watchlist-feed:
Label for a button that takes you to a list of pages you watch that have changes.
{{Identical|Modified}}
mobile-frontend-watchlist-feed-empty: Message to show when watchlist feed is empty
mobile-frontend-watchlist-filter-all:
Label on filter selector for mobile watchlist: all pages.
{{Identical|All}}. This must be a single word for layout reasons.
mobile-frontend-watchlist-filter-article:
Label on filter selector for mobile watchlist: all pages: '''content pages''' ('''articles''') only. This must be a single word for layout reasons.
{{Identical|Page}}
mobile-frontend-watchlist-filter-other:
Label on filter selector for mobile watchlist: other pages (not talk or content page).
{{Identical|Other}}. This must be a single word for layout reasons.
mobile-frontend-watchlist-filter-talk:
Label on filter selector for mobile watchlist: talk pages.
{{Identical|Talk}}. This must be a single word for layout reasons.
mobile-frontend-watchlist-more:
Label for link that shows more pages of the watchlist a-z view.
{{Identical|More}}
mobile-frontend-watchlist-please-wait: Shows if watch action is taking longer than 500ms.
mobile-frontend-watchlist-error: Shows if an error occurred whilst trying to watch the page.
mobile-frontend-watchlist-purpose: Shows on [[Special:UserLogin]] explains why someone would want to login to see a watchlist.
mobile-frontend-watchlist-removed:
Notification message when you remove a page from your watchlist
*$1 - the title of the article
mobile-frontend-watchlist-signup-action: Call to action that follows {{msg-mw|mobile-frontend-watchlist-purpose}} asking them to signup.
mobile-frontend-user-page-no-owner-page-: Heading of the call to create the user page
mobile-frontend-user-page-no-page-yet: Heading informing that no page for the user exists. $1 is the username of the user about whom the page is.
mobile-frontend-user-page-describe-yours: Body of the call to create the user page. $1 is {{msg-mw|mobile-frontend-user-page-describe-yourself-editors}}.

Used as a parameter in the message {{msg-mw|mobile-frontend-user-page-describe-yourself}}. Can be changed if a site has a special word for describing its editors, such "Wikipedians" in Wikipedia.
{{Identical|Editor}}
mobile-frontend-user-page-desired-action: Text urging the owner of the page to create the page
mobile-frontend-user-page-create-user-pa: Label of the edit button. $1 is the title of the page.
mobile-frontend-loading-message:
Hidden text existing for accessibility reasons for intermediate loaders.
{{Identical|Loading}}
mobile-frontend-search-feedback-link-tex: Text of anchor linking to a form for the user to give feedback on search results.
mobile-frontend-search-feedback-prompt: Text shown in front of an anchor linking to a form for the user to give feedback on search results.
mobile-frontend-mobile-option-MFEnableWi: An identifier for the wikidata descriptions subproject/feature
A description of the wikidata description subproject/feature
mobile-frontend-send-feedback:
Link label for sending feedback to the mobile web beta
{{Identical|Send feedback}}
mobile-frontend-mobile-option-amc: Header that appears in Special:MobileOptions for a feature that provides tooling for advanced editors.
mobile-frontend-amc-outreach-intro:
AMC feature intro displayed on AMC outreach drawer
{{Identical|Introducing Advanced Mode}}
mobile-frontend-amc-outreach-description: AMC feature description displayed on AMC outreach drawer
mobile-frontend-amc-outreach-enable:
A button on the AMC outreach drawer to enable AMC
{{Identical|Enable advanced mode}}
mobile-frontend-amc-outreach-no-thanks:
An anchor on the user on the AMC outreach drawer to dismiss the drawer
{{Identical|No thanks}}
mobile-frontend-amc-outreach-enabled-mes: A toast that displays after user enables AMC from the outreach form
mobile-frontend-amc-outreach-dismissed-m: A toast that displays after the user dismisses AMC drawer. "Settings" should be consistent with {{msg-mw|Mobile-frontend-main-menu-settings-heading}}.
mobile-frontend-beta-only: Tooltip for lock icons on mobile settings page.
mobile-frontend-console-recruit: Message that will shown in the JavaScript console to developers. Can be overridden on wiki.
mobile-frontend-special-pages-pref: This preference allows editors to disable special page optimisations in mobile. It is enabled by default.
prefs-mobile: Header for mobile section of user preferences
